item.title: About me
item.author: d11227103@ntu.edu.tw (Hau-Hung Yang)
item.description: I am a highly motivated graduate with a master’s degree in Psychology from National Taiwan University (NTU, the most prestigious university in Taiwan). I have solid training in statistics and quantitative psychology, and I have five years of research experience. For my master’s thesis, I proposed a generalization of the Robbins-Monro process (an adaptive method applicable to psychophysical experiments for threshold estimation) by incorporating other response variables, such as response time and response confidence, into the process.

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.author: d11227103@ntu.edu.tw (Hau-Hung Yang)
item.description: Paper Yang, H.‑H., & Hsu, Y.‑F. (2024). The generalized Robbins‑Monro process and its application to psychophysical experiments for threshold estimation. Journal of Mathematical Psychology. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jmp.2024.102855. Yang, H.-H., & Hsu, Y.-F. (2024). A Note on the application of stochastic approximation to computerized adaptive testing. Behaviormetrika, 1-18. https://doi.org/10.1007/s41237-023-00215-0 Working paper Yang, H.-H., & Hsu, Y. F. (Submitted). Applying a heterogeneous random utility model to data from conjoint experiments. PsyArXiv. https://doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/ytfx2 Cheng, C., Yang, H.

item.title: Research
item.author: d11227103@ntu.edu.tw (Hau-Hung Yang)
item.description: Neural Correlates of Emotion as an Arbitrator to Reconcile the Conflicts within Dual Processing in the Context of Decision Making under Risk We are performing behavioral and fMRI experiments to probe the role of emotion when people face a dual‑process induced cognitive conflict under a risky condition. I am currently engaged in the analysis of fMRI data. I am also involved in developing an estimation method for the parameters in the utility function.
